meanings.definition: To distribute information or documents to a group of people in a circular or widespread manner.
meanings.sent1: She circularised the flyers to all the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The company circularised the new policy to all employees.
meanings.sent3: The cat circularised the news of a mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: The rumor circularised through the school like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The teacher circularised the assignment details for clarity.

meanings.definition: Made circular in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The circularised table fit perfectly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The circularised rug added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The circularised cake looked like a giant donut.
meanings.sent4: The circularised garden path led to a hidden fountain.
meanings.sent5: The circularised window gave a panoramic view of the city.
